title: Moak-stats (Moak-s)
text:
The Moak-s is a portal dedicated to sharing knowledge and projects in the fields of Data Science and Statistics, with a focus on applications in financial markets, economics, agricultural experiments, and marketing. This space was created to share my experiences, research, and insights, offering relevant content for both professionals and academics interested in data analysis and its real-world applications.





Blog: Articles and reflections on the latest developments in data science, statistics, and their intersections with financial markets, economics, and marketing. From economic analyses to data-driven marketing strategy optimizations, the blog offers valuable insights for those who want to apply data science in a practical and strategic way.
Research Papers and Projects: I share my scientific articles and published papers here, covering topics such as multivariate analysis, statistical modeling, and computational statistics. Each work is aimed at solving complex problems using advanced statistics to produce practical and applicable results.
Tutorials and Practical Guides: Detailed tutorials for those who want to learn or deepen their knowledge of the tools and methodologies of data science and statistics. I offer guides for using R, Python, and other popular tools with practical applications in the financial sector, scientific experimentation, and data-driven marketing strategy optimization.






If you are a financial market professional, economist, data scientist, researcher, or someone looking for data-based solutions to optimize your projects and decisions, Moak-s was designed for you. Through accessible yet technically deep language, you can explore everything from introductory tutorials to advanced analyses, helping you improve your decision-making based on data.



Explore, learn, and connect with applied data science on Moak-s.

title: About
text: I am a PhD candidate in Statistics and Agricultural Experimentation at the Federal University of Lavras (UFLA), with a solid academic background that includes a master’s degree in the same field (2023) as well as specializations in Business Consulting and Planning (Executive MBA) and Financial Market and Banking. My professional trajectory includes teaching experience in public schools and a strong focus as a researcher, specializing in Multivariate Analysis, Computational Statistics, Data Science, Financial Markets, and Marketing. See more in lattes.

title: Moak-s
text:
The acronym SASIE comes from the Portuguese name “Sistema de Avaliação Sensorial com Informações Espaciais.” SASIE aims to estimate quality indices by considering spatial correlation structures generated by spherical, Gaussian, and exponential models. The parameter estimates related to range and nugget effect are incorporated into the index construction, accounting for the linear and quadratic model adjustments.


Data Input: Data input follows the layout shown to the side, where the first two columns represent the horizontal and vertical coordinates. The third column, exemplified as (Score), refers to a sensory attribute being evaluated for quality. Optionally, the user can upload a .txt or .csv file. Once the data is uploaded, the user can proceed to the estimation of quality indices.







Graduated in Statistics from UNESP, with a master’s and PhD in Statistics and Agricultural Experimentation from UFLA, and a postdoctoral degree from USP, he is a Full Professor in the Statistics Department and a productivity grant holder from CNPq. His research focuses on experimental design, optimization, and multivariate modeling, particularly in the areas of specialty coffee quality, sensory analysis, and consumer profiling.


With extensive experience in academic supervision, he has guided numerous undergraduate research projects, master’s dissertations, and PhD theses, and serves as a consultant for funding agencies such as CAPES, CNPq, and Fapemig. He has developed packages for R software, such as Mvar and Blendstat, and is the author of educational materials on experimental design. He also serves as an associate editor of the COFFEE SCIENCE journal and as a reviewer for national and international journals..

title: About
text:
Skills

My skills range from applying advanced statistical methods to providing business consulting, with a strong emphasis on data-driven decision-making. Throughout my education, I have also developed leadership and collaboration skills, along with participation in cultural groups.


This diverse set of skills and experiences enables me to contribute to projects that require both quantitative and qualitative analysis, process optimization, and data-driven strategies, whether in the academic, business, or financial sectors.

title: Tutorial
text:
During my time at the Federal University of Lavras (UFLA), I had the opportunity to deliver several tutorials and seminars in Portuguese (BR), including the following:



Introduction to Python Course: Covered the fundamentals of the language, from basic concepts to essential libraries.




Introduction to R Covered the fundamentals of the language, from basic concepts to essential libraries. This tutorial is planned in two parts. I present the first part here. You can find more on the YouTube channel of the Department of Statistics at UFLA.






Seminar on Code Optimization in R: Focused on optimization techniques and best practices for improving computational performance. Best Practices and Server Usage: Guidance on efficient resource management and running projects on high-performance servers.
